programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry and Neil are doing deals on a pair of unusual hand-painted unicorn sculptures, a 200-million-year-old fossil and a rare gold disc by Olivia Newton John.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan and his team at London Road have to deal with a grand bone china dinner service, an 18 carat gold bracelet and a tiny Cartier bear with a huge price tag.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in London. While Kirstie helps newlyweds Daniel and Jennie look for a home in the north of the capital, Phil joins friends Cathy, Ian and Richard as they search for a pad in one of the world's most expensive and competitive cities to buy property.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor, Berkshire. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah, who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond help Tony and Sheila search for a house in Norfolk, but Tony wants to live in the country and Sheila longs to live by the coast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the group head to The Ardingly Inn in West Sussex, where Steve and Karen Marvel hope their family country pub will win over their rivals.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Healthcare worker Bev Stewart hosts the first round of the dinner party challenge in Keighley, West Yorkshire, opting for a schooldays-themed evening featuring fish fingers, meat and potato pie, and jelly and ice-cream. However, her choice fails to impress hair salon owner Rebecca, computer network engineer Adam, sales adviser Philomena and business owner Charlie.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Computer engineer Adam Bolam-Peel hosts the second party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and plans plenty of surprises - including Northumbrian pipe playing and a poetry session. However, picky guest Philomena finds fault with his cluttered house, while Charlie cannot resist goading Rebecca about her teeth.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Image-conscious salon owner Rebecca Saunders knows she is not a great cook, and hopes her entertainment will make up for that as she hosts the competition in Keighley, West Yorkshire. She gives mock makeovers to the guests, and they are all surprised by Adam's transformation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sales adviser Philomena Golenya hosts the penultimate dinner party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and tries to impress her guests by writing her four-course menu in Italian. However, a broken chair and a small fire in the kitchen threaten to derail proceedings, until her Italian dancing proves to be a hit with one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business owner Charlie Walker hosts the final dinner party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and hopes to impress his guests with a `stylish with swimwear' dress code and hot-tub disco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks into the luxurious Lakeview Hotel on Lake Chelan, Washington, where the bedrooms are empty and the hotel's restaurant and ice-cream parlour are failing. Gordon confronts owner Brent's inappropriate and miserly behaviour, but is it enough to repair the establishment's reputation?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Paul and his American bride Alissa, who were looking for a property in Windsor, Berkshire, and revisit Malcolm and Jenny in Wiltshire who wanted a welcoming and cosy atmosphere for their prospective home.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A three-year-old Newfoundland dog needs surgery for its bent front legs, and a long-haired Chihuahua requires a total hip replacement. A woman brings in her German shepherd, which has developed a painful degenerative spinal disease requiring treatment.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dairy farmer Ben hopes to find romance with marketing assistant Alice, while classical music singer Zoe dines with amateur dramatics enthusiast Tim. The restaurant also welcomes Sara, who has been single for eight years. Could straight-talking animal lover and dog trainer Nicky be the right woman for her?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word `hon', a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denise's unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Somerset to see Ed and Vicky Versluys and their cow shed conversion. A year after his last visit and with the house finally complete, Kevin finds out what it's like living in an off-grid home designed for animals.(n)

programme.title: Cabins in the Wild with Dick Strawbridge
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Will Hardie meet the teams working on a cabin inspired by a national coal pit and a modernist design made entirely from slate. Dick also travels to East Sussex to visit a cabin modelled on an airship cockpit as he and Will prepare to engineer the mechanism that will allow their own cabin to extend to 10 metres in length.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: In this art deco special, George takes on a challenging period property in Newquay, owned by Gareth and Frances Jenkins. The building was once an architectural gem, but over the years has been the victim of unsympathetic modernisations, making it unrecognisable from its 1930s heyday. The challenge is to strip away the ugly accretions to reveal the house in all its glory - while also making it suitable for modern family living. Plus, George visits a stunning seaside home and Britain's biggest collection of neon signs.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: Watto is ecstatic when his errant mum Pauline arrives back on the scene, seemingly oblivious to her son's multimillion-pound fortune and claiming to have made one all of her own. The boys are initially impressed, but Ewan's growing suspicions lead him to stage an intervention that goes horribly awry. Casey announces that her boss is flying to London specifically to hear Josh and Leon's ideas for the new game, and is rattled when she learns that they have nothing to pitch.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Ben Fogle takes his Labrador along the banks of the Thames, beginning in Marlow, while broadcaster Emma Kennedy and her maltipoo puppy visit the Lake District. Plus, Helen Skelton and her dog Barney embark on a voyage of discovery in Dumfries and Galloway, on Scotland so-called `secret coast'.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton heads to California to investigate alternative dairy products at one of California's leading producers of almond milk, before meeting a scientist who has been raising genetically engineered goats whose milk he hopes might one day save half a million lives every year. Jimmy Doherty teams up with a fish detective on a covert mission buying and testing fish in Edinburgh to make sure it is the real deal, while Matt Tebbutt finds out what goes into spreadable butter.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan and his team are hoping to do deals on some designer jewellery, an ancient coin that could be over 700 years old, and a jewel-encrusted luxury watch. In London, pawnbroking duo Nathan and Debbs go to look at a pair of vintage toy replica racing cars and an unusual piano accordion in mint condition.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwicks in London, Nathan John Finch and Debs Franklin are doing deals on a pair of original fish paintings and an original theatre organ with a £35,000 asking price.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two first-time buyers in Manchester. Interior designer Abigail Carpe is looking for a two-bedroom period home in the southern suburbs with a limited budget, while David Isaac has £235,000 to spend on a city-centre pad to share with his girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with a family who were looking for a seaside home in Broadstairs, Kent, and also revisit Tara Magee and Alastair Murray, who were struggling to buy their first home together in Edinburgh, despite having a budget of £600,000.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Paul and Mandy search Sussex for their first home together, big enough for her teenagers and to entertain friends. But while she wants the countryside, he feels the pull of the sea.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests spend their final night in Christine Adams' medieval Ware Hall in Norfolk - and while Adam is won over the romance and history, Steve and Karen find the dust too much.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Catherine Williams creates a menu inspired by South America for the first dinner party of the week in Leeds. She is joined by Garth Kirsten-Landman from South Africa, company administrator Louise Emmerson, banker Sam Appleby and property developer Diane Jones. Straight-talker Garth causes widespread offence, but the host maintains a positive mood with a painting session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Garth Kirsten-Landman cooks kangaroo meat as he hosts the second night in Leeds. However, after his sexist jokes and inaccurate age-guessing on day one, the South African has a lot of making up to do - but things get off to a bad start when he apologises for his meal before it has even been served.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Banker Sam Appleby wears a Henry VIII costume, complete with enormous codpiece, for his best-of-British-themed evening, as he hosts the third dinner party in Leeds. Property developer Diane's Margaret Thatcher costume causes some conflict, but there is some brief harmony when a busker arrives to lead the guests in singing a Beatles song.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Company administrator Louise Emmerson serves a Mediterranean menu inspired by her former mother-in-law, featuring Madrid chicken and aubergine bake. However, the guests are not impressed by the food, and Sam Appleby stokes the simmering feud between Diane Jones and the host, much to the shock of the other diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Property developer Diane Jones hosts the final dinner party in Leeds, and her guests have high expectations for the evening. She rustles up Greek filo pastries and cod in Italian sauce as well as entertaining her diners with Brazilian dancing on the lawn, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two sets of first-time buyers - Isobel Phillips and Chris Martin, who were desperate to find their dream family home in the Cotswolds before getting married, and Claire Winship, a student looking to spend her £1.7million budget on a riverside apartment on London's South Bank.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers who are struggling to find homes. In Southampton, Jenny and Tom are keen to move out of their cramped rental property and into a house of their own, but they are facing fierce competition and a fast market. Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd, taking on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Women who claim benefits while looking after several children. They include Chesterfield mum Maria, who has five kids to five different dads and has not worked since 2002. She is so desperate to get off benefits she has signed herself up to the same college course as her daughter. Birmingham woman Karen has six children and a seventh on the way with partner Ashleigh - and although his job search is not going well he keeps himself busy in other ways. In Weymouth, Kate picks up almost £30,000 a year in benefits to supplement her husband Ian's income as a taxi driver - and spends more than £170 a month of this on pocket money for her seven kids.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary about parents prepared to go to extreme lengths to get what they always wanted for their children, including Essex millionaire Irene. However, eldest daughter Samantha has decided to turn her back on her mum's excessive displays of wealth. Cameras also follow 31-year-old stockbroker Bobby, who gives his 11-year-old daughter Lilly Rae anything if it spurs her on to greater success in life.(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Kurt Russell stars in this action-packed thriller about a terrorism expert whose team tries to rescue a hijacked plane carrying nerve gas. Steven Seagal, Halle Berry, John Leguizamo, Oliver Platt, Joe Morton. Stuart Baird ("U.S. Marshals") directed(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Warped, crudely funny comedy about a boozy conman who robs the department stores where he works as Santa(n)

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: The entire ensemble cast from the original smash-hit sex comedy returns for this even more outrageous sequel. After their first year of college, Jim (Jason Biggs) and his randy pals rent a beach house for summer fun and games. When Jim learns that gorgeous exchange student Nadia (Shannon Elizabeth) will be paying a visit, he decides to get some quick lessons in love. Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Conor O'Neill is usually one step ahead of the loan sharks. But this time, his debts force him to accept a job coaching tough Chicago kids. Conor plans to take the money and run, but when the team starts looking up to him, he realises he'll have to take responsibility for the first time in his life(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Halle Berry's Oscar-winning performance highlights this wrenching tale about racism, redemption and the power of love. She plays a poor Southerner who falls for a prison guard (Billy Bob Thornton) following the execution of her husband (played by rapper Sean Combs). Peter Boyle, Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: The hands-down best of the Bruce Lee kung fu vehicles, Enter the Dragon finds Lee infiltrating the island stronghold of suspected drug kingpin Shih Kien. Ostensibly on the island to enter a martial arts contest, Lee finds himself matched against Kien's fiercest henchman, Bob Wall. He kills Wall, but is unable to escape the many booby traps festooning the island. The final battle royale pits Lee against Kien, and Lee's former army buddy John Saxon against the formidable Yang Tse. There's more to the plot than that, of course, but action fans of 1973 weren't interested in the intrigues--they wanted to "cut to the chase" and revel in Bruce Lee's split-second chopsocky technique. Enter the Dragon is so good that it even survives the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker parody in Kentucky Fried Movie (1977)(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: After being left at the altar, a singer tries to piece his life back together with a waitress in this romantic comedy set in 1985(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: In this installment of the "Vacation" series, the youngest son of the Griswold clan, now grown with a family of his own, sets out to recreate a cross-country road trip from his youth to an amusement park(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: After being discharged from the Army, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) moves back to Queens and takes a job in a bar run by Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown), who teaches Brian the fine art of bartending. Brian quickly becomes a patron favorite with his flashy drink-mixing style. Brian adopts his mentor's cynical philosophy on life and goes for the money. He leaves his artist girlfriend Jordan Mooney (Elisabeth Shue) for Bonnie (Lisa Banes), a wealthy, high-powered executive. Brian soon must chose between the two, as he evaluates his options. Scriptwriter Heywood Gould displayed his sense of humor when assigning the character name "Mr. Mooney" to Lucille Ball's real-life son-in-law, actor Laurence Luckenbill. Television fans of The Lucy Show will recall Mr. Mooney, played by Gale Gordon, as Lucy's fussy financial boss. The film is more memorable for the 17-song soundtrack and plays like a series of MTV videos. Cocktail was a big draw at the box office in 1988(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Director John Woo brings Hong Kong-style martial arts action to this comic book-flavored sequel that eschews the complicated plot and political maneuverings of its predecessor in favor of pure, adrenaline-charged thrills. Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt, an operative for the top-secret government agency IMF (Impossible Missions Force). Fellow agent Sean Ambrose (Dougray Scott) has gone rogue, stealing a sample of a deadly synthetic virus named Chimera that could rapidly wipe out the world's population. Ambrose's plan is to sell Chimera to the highest bidder in exchange for shares of stock in the winner's company. Summoned by the new IMF chief (Anthony Hopkins in an uncredited cameo role), Ethan is assigned to recruit the help of Ambrose's former lover Nyah Nordoff-Hall (Thandie Newton), a gorgeous woman who left Ambrose broken-hearted and who may be able to quickly regain his confidence. Once he meets and spends a night with Nyah, however, Ethan is smitten, and now must both capture Ambrose and keep Nyah alive as she infiltrates a nest of vipers. Sophisticated disguises, gun battles, and high-speed chases are the order of the day, very much in the James Bond mold. Mission: Impossible 2 is based on a story by Star Trek: The Next Generation writers Ronald D. Moore and Brannon Braga, with a script polish by Robert Towne(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Marvel Comics adventures of Peter Parker, a nerdy high-school student who is transformed into a web-spinning vigilante(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: Vigilante Diaries
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding action flick, a team of crime fighters travel the globe as they battle a group of spies, the Armenian mob and a trio of mysterious women with dark intentions(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a disastrous summer, Harry returns to begin his fifth year at Hogwarts, one of the toughest he will ever have. A few group of students and parents believe him or Dumbledore that Voldemort is really back, and a never-ending series of articles states that they are insane. On top of that, Dolores Umbridge, the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, proves to be the nastiest person Harry has ever encountered(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: Four lifelong best friends embark on separate paths for their first year of college and the summer beyond(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy fashion magazine(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: LA journalist Steve Lopez begins writing a column about a mentally ill homeless man with a talent for playing the cello. Lopez tries to help improve his life, but finds his new friend's state of mind a stumbling block. Drama(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: The creation of one of the most memorable books of the 1960s -- and the impact the writing and research would have on its author -- is explored in this drama based on a true story. In 1959, Truman Capote (played by Philip Seymour Hoffman) was a critically acclaimed novelist who had earned a small degree of celebrity for his work when he read a short newspaper item about a multiple murder in a small Kansas town. For some reason, the story fascinated Capote, and he asked William Shawn (Bob Balaban), his editor at The New Yorker, to let him write a piece about the case. Capote had long believed that in the right hands, a true story could be molded into a tale as compelling as any fiction, and he believed this event, in which the brutal and unimaginable was visited upon a community where it was least expected, could be just the right material. Capote traveled to Kansas with his close friend Harper Lee (Catherine Keener), herself becoming a major literary figure with the success of To Kill a Mockingbird, and while Capote's effete and mannered personal style stuck out like a sore thumb in Kansas, in time he gained the trust of Alvin Dewey (Chris Cooper), the Kansas Bureau of Investigation agent investigating the murder of the Clutter family, and with his help Capote's magazine piece grew into a full-length book. Capote also became familiar with the petty criminals who killed the Clutter family, Dick Hickock (Mark Pellegrino) and Perry Smith (Clifton Collins Jr.), and in Smith he found a troubling kindred spirit more like himself than he wanted to admit. After attaining a sort of friendship with Smith under the assumption that the man would be executed before the book was ever published, Capote finds himself forced to directly confront the moral implications of his actions with regards to both his role in the man's death, and the way that he would be remembered. Capote also co-stars Bruce Greenwood as Capote's longtime companion Jack Dunphy, and Amy Ryan as Mary Dewey, Alvin's wife who became a confidante of Capote's(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.desc: The relatives of a wealthy woman found in a coma come under suspicion when the team investigates her subsequent death. David Dukes guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team examines the apparently accidental death of a man trying to solve the killing of his son in Chile 30 years earlier. As the investigations gather pace, the officers are embroiled in a belated murder trial.(n)

programme.desc: Deeks is rushed to hospital after being shot during a robbery at a convenience store, leaving Callen and Sam to hunt the culprits. programme.desc: Documentary-makers filming the antics of a rock band follow the team when one of the musicians is found murdered in his trailer. programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine dispenses the social security number of Vanessa Watkins - a prosecuting attorney who has just reported that her husband has gone missing from their yacht. The detective in charge of the investigation has a grudge against the lawyer and arrests her on suspicion of murder, but in a series of daring and enterprising escapes she evades police custody and becomes the focus of a city-wide manhunt. Meanwhile, Carter remains unaware her new partner Laskey is an HR spy and is reporting back to Terney. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Animal rights activists are implicated in the death of an Aids researcher killed by a bite from an infected monkey, and use the ensuing court case to drum up support for their cause. As events unfold, McCoy and Carmichael find themselves debating ethics with lawyers who argue the protection of animal life is a valid defence in a murder case.(n)

programme.desc: A rocket engine expert is killed, leaving Eric to go undercover to ensure that classified technology remains secure. programme.desc: Androzene promotes male sexual health and nourishes the body(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The Colonel's Horse. Hawkeye and Potter provide assistance at a Korean clinic, and run into an enemy attack on the way home. Meanwhile, Klinger begins posing as a Gypsy to help get his discharge papers(n)

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: Tom Cruise and Jack Nicholson star in a compelling drama in which a young and impetuous naval lieutenant and a more experienced officer are given the job of defending two marines accused of murder. As the two officers come to terms with one another, their investigation uncovers some sinister secrets and collusion at the highest level. The marines' commanding officer certainly has no intention of making the truth public(n)

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: Action adventure about a small-town group of gun-toting teenagers and a washed-out ex-Marine who become the first line of defence when a Soviet/ Cuban invasion of the US begins(n)

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone revives the character of traumatised Vietnam vet John Rambo after a 15-year absence. Holed up in the jungles of Thailand, Rambo is hired to ferry missionary aid workers into Burma, where they minister to the beleaguered Karen people. When Burmese soldiers attack the Karen village, Rambo is asked to transport a mercenary rescue team(n)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Brad Pitt leads a tank crew in the final days of World War II in this war drama from End of Watch's David Ayer. The year is 1945. Army sergeant Wardaddy (Brad Pitt) is the grizzled commander of a Sherman tank. Determined to strike a decisive victory for the Allies in the European Theater, Wardaddy leads his five-man crew on a treacherous mission behind enemy lines. His mission complicated by the sudden appearance of a rookie soldier in his platoon, the sergeant knows that victory is within reach, and vows to achieve it by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich's blockbuster stars Dennis Quaid as climatologist Jack Hall; a lone voice predicting that global warming will lead to a new ice age. He is ridiculed for his views, but his fears swiftly come true when a dramatic temperature rise in the Antarctic causes the world's weather to go mad, with tornadoes devastating Los Angeles, Britain literally flash-frozen and New York first inundated by floods and then overwhelmed by a killer cold snap. A few survivors, including Jack's son Sam, take refuge in a library and Jack sets out on a desperate mission to save them. The action-packed film (which won a BAFTA for its stunning special effects) may have compressed and dramatised the effects of global warming but, disturbingly, the basic science Emmerich uses in the film to advance the plot isn't that far removed from the increasing dangers the world faces today(n)

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 1 2 3
programme.desc: The late Tony Scott's remake of the 1974 thriller, starring John Travolta and Denzel Washington. It's a day that the passengers on a New York subway train are unlikely to forget. And it's one that could rescue the professional life of subway employee Walter Garber, whose glittering career has been derailed by allegations of corruption. Garber is languishing on duty as a train dispatcher when all hell breaks loose after one of the Lexington Avenue line trains is hijacked by a gang led by the supremely self-assured, calmly ruthless Ryder. Ryder issues a demand for $10m and makes it clear that he won't hesitate to kill anyone who gets in his way. Garber and NYPD hostage negotiator Lieutenant Camonetti attempt to get to grips with the crisis but, as events progress, suspicions arise as to whether there's more to the hijacking than first meets the eye. Also starring James Gandolfini as New York's mayor and Luis Guzmán as a disgruntled subway worker who has joined Ryder's gang(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A rag-tag group of con artists and ex-cons team up for the heist to end all heists in this high-profile remake of the 1960 Rat Pack favorite. As with its predecessor, Ocean's Eleven opens with its titular hero Danny Ocean (George Clooney stepping into the Frank Sinatra role) eager for a new challenge. The similarities to the original end there, as Ocean conspires with his old pal Rusty Ryan (Brad Pitt) to rob 150 million dollars from an underground vault that serves three of Las Vegas' biggest casinos. Between the two of them, they recruit nine other men, each with his own criminal specialty, to assist in the mission: moneyman Reuben Tishkoff (Elliot Gould), card dealer Frank (Bernie Mac), pickpocket Linus (Matt Damon), aging con artist Saul (Carl Reiner), British explosives pro Basher (Don Cheadle), techie Dell (Eddie Jemison), rude-boy brothers Virgil (Casey Affleck) and Turk (Scott Caan), and professional acrobat Yen (Shaobo Qin). What Ocean doesn't tell the group is that there's another reason he's coordinating the heist: the three casinos they're robbing are all owned by ruthless gambling mogul Terry Benedict (Andy Garcia), who just happens to be married to Ocean's former love Tess (Julia Roberts). Ocean's Eleven was updated by scribe Ted Griffin and marked the third feature shot by director Steven Soderbergh under the alias Peter Andrews(n)

programme.title: The Son
programme.desc: Second Empire. Young Eli trains as a warrior, but makes enemies in 1849. In 1915, Eli and Phineas struggle to help the family in Austin, while Pete faces his demons(n)

programme.title: The Son
programme.desc: Death Song. Young Eli faces a life-or-death test of survival in 1849. In 1915, the McCulloughs enact a dangerous plan to take the fight to their enemy(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Stone Age Romeos. The boys are cavemen who fight for their women in "Stone Age Romeos"(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: They Stooge to Conga. The boys are repairmen who foil Axis spys in the violent "They Stooge to Conga." Lloyd Bridges, Vernon Dent, Dudley Dickerson(n)

programme.desc: Hawk's Nightmare. Havoc ensues when Radar removes a spirit post from the road. When an elderly Korean man is brought in for medical attention, he refuses surgery unless the spirits in the camp are exorcised(n)

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity thrusts a young man into the middle of a war being plotted by two rival crime lords in this twist-filled thriller(n)

programme.title: Young Guns
programme.desc: A group of young cowhands, led by Billy the Kid, are deputised to hunt down the murderer of their rancher-boss. But when Billy takes their authority too far, they become the hunted(n)

programme.title: Young Guns II
programme.desc: Only three of the original five "young guns" -- Billy the Kid (Emilio Estevez), Jose Chavez y Chavez (Lou Diamond Phillips), and Doc Scurlock (Kiefer Sutherland) -- return in Young Guns II, which is the story of Billy the Kid and his race to safety in Old Mexico while being trailed by a group of government agents led by Pat Garrett (William Petersen). Along the way, Billy's crew gains three new recruits: Arkansas Dave Rudabaugh (Christian Slater), Tom O'Folliard (Balthazar Getty), and Hendry French (Alan Ruck). Though the film suffers from an uneven script, many performances -- particularly Slater's -- are surprisingly strong, and the movie looks great. The theme song, "Blaze of Glory," is performed by Jon Bon Jovi in his first solo appearance; the rocker also has a cameo in the film(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three bright young students venture deep into the Nevada desert in search of a notorious hacker, and discover they have been drawn into an enigmatic plot with terrifying repercussions in this mind-bending sci-fi thriller. Intrigued by reports that a mysterious hacker named Nomad has breached MIT's advanced security system and exposed its flaws, freshmen Nic (Brenton Thwaites) and Jonah (Beau Knapp) hop in the car with Nick's girlfriend Hailey (Olivia Cooke), and attempt to track down the elusive computer genius. Eventually, the trail of clues leads the three students deep into the Nevada desert. There, they finally come face-to-face with Nomad just before everything goes black. Later, regaining consciousness in a high-security government facility, a confused Nic quickly finds that the worst is yet to come. Laurence Fishburne co-stars(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Mistaken for terrorists, stoners Harold and Kumar are thrown into maximum security prison(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: Graphically violent story of a Miami-based mob boss - a Cuban refugee who works his way through gangland competition and builds up a nationwide drug-trafficking empire which then collapses around him. Oliver Stone's screenplay was adapted from Ben Hecht's script for the original 1932 version of the film starring Paul Muni(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: An American family living in India are devastated when their son is killed in an accident. The wife soon performs a Hindu ritual to speak to the dead, but her actions cause her family to be haunted by an otherworldly force in this chilling horror film(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship Essex struggle for their survival after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: Bike courier Jim wakes up in a London hospital to find the place deserted. Evading a crew of crazed killers, he learns that humanity has been virtually wiped out by a leaked virus. Zombie horror featuring an extra, post-credits downbeat ending(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover. The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: Peter Parker is attempting to juggle college classes and his job as a photographer with the Daily Bugle while maintaining his secret life as costumed crime-fighter Spider-Man. Parker is also struggling to hold on to his relationship with Mary Jane Watson, who is beginning to enjoy success as a model and actress, and both Mary Jane and Peter have noticed he's beginning to buckle under the strain(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Comic book action fantasy. The big red demon with the stone hand returns with his buddies from the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense to save the world when an evil elf breaks an ancient pact and unleashes a robot army to destroy humanity(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy in this taut crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: Visceral horror thriller in which the mechanical devices in the town of Wilmington, North California, start to go dangerously haywire. Eventually, the surviving inhabitants gather in the town's diner, besieged by malevolent driverless trucks which seem intent on destroying everything and everyone. Horror master Stephen King's directorial debut(n)

programme.title: On Time
programme.desc: A woman who is running late for a job interview is forced to make a tough decision. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: Filmmakers Ryan Fleck and Anna Boden (Half Nelson) weave this introspective sports drama concerning a talented Dominican baseball player who longs to break into the American big league and earn the money needed to support his impoverished family. Miguel Santos is a talented pitcher who might just have what it takes to earn a prized spot on a Major League Baseball team, but before that happens he'll have to prove his worth in the minor leagues. Advancing into the United States' minor league system at the tender age of 19, Miguel is warmly welcomed into the small-town Iowa home of his host family, but can't help but struggle with language and cultural barriers despite the kindness of strangers. Subsequently forced to reevaluate his life's ambition after his once-trusty arm becomes unreliable, the previously single-minded pitcher gradually begins to question both the world he lives in and the role he has chosen to play in it(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Buckle up for a wild ride as Paul Walker ("Joy Ride") and Vin Diesel ("Pitch Black") put the pedal to the metal in this high-octane action thriller. Diesel plays the leader of a gang of L.A. street racers who moonlight in highway robbery; Walker is the undercover cop who befriends him. Michelle Rodriguez, Jordana Brewster, Rick Yune, Chad Lindberg(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: San Francisco Police Inspector 'Dirty' Harry Callahan and his new partner, Early Smith have been temporarily reassigned from Homicide to Stakeout Duty. Meanwhile, those of the city's criminals who manage to avoid punishment by the courts are nevertheless being killed by unknown assassins. Callahan begins to investigate the murders despite the orders of his superior officer, Lieutenant Briggs. A man has to know his limitations..(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: A macho cop goes undercover as a schoolteacher as part of his efforts to prosecute an elusive drug dealer, but quickly finds out he's no match for a roomful of feisty 6-year-olds(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Everyone knows it takes an Undercover Brother to foil The Man. This time, The Man has launched Operation Whitewash, a plot to undermine an African-American general's presidential ambitions. But with the Undercover Brother (Eddie Griffin) on the case, alongside his sexy sidekick, Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), the general is sure to see the inside of the Oval Office. The 70's fashion-fabulous duo dons the latest in country club attire to infiltrate The Man's plan and root out his evil accomplice the White She Devil (Denise Richards)(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: Explosive action-adventure in which Sylvester Stallone plays a cop on the warpath, who sets out to stop a band of murderous criminals who are threatening to bring the city to its knees(n)

programme.desc: Tom Horn - Grim Reaper of the Rockies. A profile of Tom Horn (1860-1903), who was prized as a scout by the U.S. Calvary in the 1880s during the Apache Wars, but became infamous as a hired assassin whose chief targets were cattle thieves(n)

programme.desc: John Wesley Hardin - The Dark Heart of Texas. John Wesley Hardin (1853-95) becomes a notorious cattle rustler in Texas and Kansas in the 1870s, known for his bad temper and habit of settling quarrels with his gun(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Since the beginning of the HIV virus epidemic, more than 70 million people have been infected and about 35 million have died of HIV-related illnesses. Chris van Tulleken reveals how the latest treatments mean that a diagnosis need not be a death sentence. He also looks at the importance of testing and considers whether HIV could ever be eradicated for ever, while Elton John discusses the initial stigma against gay men, a result of the misinformation and fear when HIV and Aids first entered mainstream consciousness 30 years ago.(n)

programme.desc: The Moons' search takes a positive turn this week as Kat finally meets her son. But will this be the happy-ever-after she has been hoping for? Elsewhere, Agnes organises a memorial barbecue, although she is not happy when the Moons show their faces, while Eileen comes to realise how much she and Kieran are missing in America, prompting her to wonder whether she should stay in Ireland permanently. Drama, starring Jessie Wallace, Shane Richie, Fionnula Flanagan and Angeline Ball.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on Muhammad Ali
programme.desc: The comedian learns more about his hero, boxing icon Muhammad Ali, by visiting key locations and people in his life. In Ali's hometown of Louisville, Kentucky, he meets the boxer's brother Rahman and his former wife Khalilah, who was alongside him in the turbulent years when he was banned from the ring for refusing to fight in Vietnam. Frank also meets a bare-knuckle boxer from Oxfordshire who became one of Ali's dearest friends, and visits the Pennsylvania training compound where Ali and his team prepared for the Rumble in the Jungle. With contributions from Nicola Adams, Larry Holmes and Ali's business manager Gene Kilroy.(n)

programme.desc: Photographer Claire Seville's father George left the family home when she was three months old, so a Leeds-based family tracing agency attempts to track him down. In an emotional encounter, Claire and her sister Sarah attempt to discover George's motives for leaving them behind.(n)

programme.desc: Repercussions from past events lead to an ill-advised liaison and an evacuation of the Garda station, while Paudge hopes another's misfortune will help his situation.(n)

programme.desc: Michaela Strachan accompanies the six orphaned elephants to their release site in northern Tsavo. Meanwhile, back in Nairobi, the four babies struggle to cope with the loss of their mini-matriarch. Jonathan Scott prepares for action as four much bigger female orphans are separated from Emily's huge herd in the hope that they will ease the transition in Ithumba.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon investigates ancient routes and shrines across Europe that are still being used, trying to find out whether modern pilgrims are motivated by religious devotion or a sense of adventure. In the French town of St Omer, he finds piles of shoes left on the tomb of a 7th-century saint with notes pleading for children to be cured of their walking difficulties. Simon also visits the Way of St James, a 500-mile route that starts in the French town of St Jean-Pied-du-Port, crosses the Pyrenees, winds through northern Spain and finishes in the holy city of Santiago de Compostela.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a celebrity edition of the show, as string quartet Bond and composer David Arnold take on the winners of famous game shows for a chance to win money for charity.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Scotland chefs hope to impress with their main dishes. Angela Malik prepares a tiffin box featuring a summer biriyani, quail scotch egg and spiced quail breasts, while Michael Bremner takes a huge risk by using ox tongue as the centrepiece of his main. Ally McGrath devises an inventive take on the summer barbecue, using a new method of cooking potatoes to recreate the coals.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the grand final of the pastry chef contest, with the contestants spending eight hours preparing specially themed desserts with an elaborate sculptural centrepiece for a party attended by more than 100 guests at Firle Place, Sussex. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin assess their efforts, and decide who is this year's champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent, Fitzpatrick and Lavender meet a group of men from a local publishing company, raising the alpha male stakes when the trio discover the exciting perks the publishers receive in their line of business, namely company cars. In the showroom, receptionist Carol tries to get to grips with the new office computer. Elsewhere, in a bid to save face, Fitzpatrick puts faith in his comprehensive knowledge of the company Cachet's home turf, with potentially dangerous consequences for everyone concerned.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: A comic look behind the scenes at the political parties, reacting to the day's themes, rows and catastrophes, written and directed by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part two of two. Engineers must construct and fit out a new station at Paddington and erect a great glass canopy to soar above the structure, while workers at Tottenham Court Road are building underground platforms and concourses the size of an aircraft carrier in the heart of the world's busiest shopping district. In Derby, a father and son team race to construct 66 trains to ferry passengers across the 30 miles of Crossrail line.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Medical journalist and chronic insomniac Michael Mosley journeys into the world of sleep, finding out what it is and what happens to someone if they do not get enough. Michael seeks to discover whether his own insomnia runs in the family, sending off a blood sample for DNA analysis, and meets Dr Eleanor Scott in Leeds who is doing research into a possible link between Type 2 diabetes and lack sleep. He also looks at possible ways in which people can go about getting a better night's sleep, including a visit to a project in Denmark to find out if a night under the stars can reset his body clock.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Vet
programme.desc: In the final episode, Judy Puddifoot investigates the warning signs dogs give out before becoming aggressive, and Steve Leonard looks into the latest research that suggests feeding your cat only fish-based pet foods over the long term could lead to health problems. Elsewhere, Alice Rhodes discovers that one in five cats in the UK lives in a state of long-term anxiety because they share a house with another cat, and she runs a series of unique experiments to test different stress-reducing methods. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British flying doctor swoops to the rescue after a little boy becomes trapped in machinery and two UK policemen race to catch a dangerous driver on the beach.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate packaging issues with food products, and assess why many people say one well-known product is too difficult to open.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred Paul Ainsworth takes part in the culinary challenge, putting three home cooks through their paces including a test of their butchery skills. Sheree Murphy presents.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Five new teams compete for the last two semi-final places. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin challenge them to finely craft two batches of perfectly uniform miniatures, 36 Fraisiers and 36 verrines, in just 150 minutes. For the final challenge, the teams are required to reinvent a pavlova. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents the latest political news, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman returns with the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: The Salvation Army Family Tracing Unit helps Mary Kitchen from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, track down her estranged brother Lennie, who she lost contact with more than 30 years ago. Plus, 81-year-old retired musician Linda Wright, who only found out she was adopted when she was 20 years old, asks genealogist Charlie Watson to lend a hand in finding out whether she has any living biological relatives.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Patricia picks a bad day to enter the Kielys' den, causing stress for Claire and James McKay. Angela's patience is tested by a sorry shoplifter and a vindictive visitor.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the British tradition of cooking with food hunted from the land and prepare a selection of dishes using rabbit, grouse and venison.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Emily's keepers consider sending her back into the wild when she becomes irritable and overly dominant. Michaela Strachan meets the newest arrival in the sanctuary, happy baby Jipe, and Jonathan Scott follows a recently released herd of 10, which is attacked by a rabid dog.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon follows in the footsteps of travellers who made long, arduous and dangerous journeys to reach Jerusalem, where every year millions of Christians, Jews and Muslims still go to worship. In the Old City, he joins in the ancient ritual of walking along the Via Dolorosa, the route taken by Jesus as He carried the cross to the site of His crucifixion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon begin this leg of their journey in Aberdeen before travelling through the coastal town of Cullen to an auction at Elgin in Moray. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Phil Tufnell, Michael Buerk and Naga Munchetty use their knowledge and debating skills to help Manchester solicitor Paul win the cash prize. Hosted by comedian Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: A team from Strictly Come Dancing takes on the general knowledge champions. Professionals Robin Windsor, Karen Clifton and Kevin Clifton, 2015 champion Jay McGuiness, People's Strictly winner Cassidy Little and former contestant Anthony Ogogo are the ones hoping to dance circles around the general knowledge champions.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Angela Malik, Ally McGrath and Michael Bremner continue their battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Scotland final.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The first week draws to a close at the National Trust's Sherborne Estate in the heart of the Cotswolds, where Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke report live on the latest wildlife action. Martin Hughes-Games and Iolo Williams are in north Wales, where they search for the elusive sand lizard.(n)

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: In the wake of Philip's death, Paula notices some things missing from her home and wonders whether James was somehow involved. Mac's superior is determined to believe it was suicide, so the detective starts digging into James's past - while the handyman himself is struggling to cope living with two warring women. When Crystal accuses Morgan of speaking to the police and reacts violently, James hallucinations get increasingly worse and he goes on the run. Revenge thriller, starring Denise Gough, Tom Hughes and Owen McDonnell.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites Jason Manford, Sara Pascoe, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of `noble rot'. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: England v Bangladesh. Action from the opening match of the tournament, which saw the Group A teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a series of journeys through London and its environs, beginning in the Buckinghamshire market town of Amersham, where he discovers the foundations of modern-day suburbia. In Pinner, he finds out about a Victorian domestic goddess, investigates the terraced catacombs of Highgate cemetery and ends with a trip to London Zoo in Regent's Park.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Bridging the Gap - How the Severn Bridge Was Built.
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as `the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident.(n)

programme.title: Koko: The Gorilla Who Talks to People
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of the only `talking' gorilla in the world, Koko, and her lifelong relationship with animal psychologist Penny Patterson. Project Koko began as a PhD project to teach sign language to a baby gorilla, but an intense bond formed between the pair, and they have now been together for over 40 years. More than 2,000 hours of footage chart the most dramatic moments of Koko's unique life with Penny, from the battle to prevent the gorilla being taken back to the zoo in which she was born, to a clash with academic critics.(n)

programme.title: The Girl Who Talked to Dolphins
programme.desc: Documentary exploring an attempt to teach a dolphin to understand English. In the 1960s, a scientist flooded a house and invited a young woman to live there full time with the animal in the hope that the creature would be able to communicate with her. Featuring contributions from those involved in the experiment, who are speaking about events for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary following animal rights lawyer Steven Wise in an unprecedented challenge, as he and his legal team file the first lawsuits that seek to transform an animal from something with no rights, to one with legal protection. Supported by affidavits from primatologists, Steven maintains that, based on scientific evidence, cognitively complex animals such as chimpanzees, whales, dolphins and elephants have the capacity for limited personhood rights.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Queen of Tigers: Natural World Special.
programme.desc: Machli is one of the world's most famous tigers - the star of five films, with her own Facebook page and more than a million YouTube hits of her attacking a crocodile. Wildlife cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson returns to India to find his old friend in this documentary charting the extraordinary milestones in Machli's life as a mother and a hunter.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of Murder: A Horizon Guide.
programme.desc: Michael Mosley uses footage from the BBC archives to chart scientists' progress as they looked at the mind of a murderer in an attempt to understand why people commit such crimes, asking whether they are driven to it by circumstances or are simply born to kill.(n)

programme.title: Mud, Sweat and Tractors: The Story of Agriculture
programme.desc: The documentary examining British food production during the 20th century looks at how the Hereford and Aberdeen Angus breeds of cattle have evolved over the years, since the nation earned the reputation of `the Stockyard of the World' before the Second World War. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Eurythmics, Spandau Ballet, Phil Collins, Fine Young Cannibals, Tears for Fears, Suzanne Vega and Simply Red.(n)

programme.title: Fossil Wonderlands: Nature's Hidden Treasures
programme.desc: Professor Richard Fortey Investigates the remains of an ancient volcanic lake, which contains well-preserved examples of early mammals and giant insects - including bats, dog-sized `dawn' horses and ants as large as a hummingbird. The area also houses what could be the oldest known human ancestor to be found. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Great Village Green Crusade
programme.desc: Documentary about Red Dwarf actor and eco-enthusiast Robert Llewellyn's two-year campaign to persuade the residents of his Cotswolds village, Temple Guiting, to generate more of their own power through renewable sources.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell follow each step of the process as a gas installation is pulled from the North Sea by floating cranes, then taken to Newcastle to be disassembled and recycled. They learn how the components of the platform contribute to the process of gas extraction, and talk to engineers about the emotional impact of working on such a remote facility.(n)

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston explores the forensic advances that have elevated murder weapons from mere instruments to crucial pieces of evidence. She sees how arsenic, the undetectable weapon of choice in the 19th century, was exposed as the killer thanks to one simple chemical test, and finds out how distinctive marks on a victim's skull led to the weapon and, in turn, the killer. Gabriel also looks at the latest forensic developments, from 3-D laser scanning that can reconstruct the sequence of events at the scene of a gun crime to the pioneering chemistry able to determine where in the world someone has been based on just a few strands of their hair.(n)

programme.title: Aviva Premiership Rugby Highlights
programme.desc: Wasps and Exeter Chiefs go head-to-head in the Aviva Premiership final at Twickenham. Wasps, who last won the famous trophy in 2008, face a Chiefs side unbeaten in 16 league games.(n)

programme.title: Scottish Professional Football League
programme.desc: Hamilton Academical host Dundee United in the second leg of the Ladbrokes Premiership play-off final at New Douglas Park. The sides played out a 0-0 draw in the first leg.(n)

Ruth is devastated at her husband's behaviour and seeks Mike's advice.(n)

programme.desc: Debra is heartbroken to discover her parents have decided to split up and go their separate ways. Comedy, starring Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.desc: Frank offers to paint Ray's house - but refuses to use the colours he and Debra wanted. Ray Romano and Peter Boyle star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: An invitation to a school reunion drops through Frasier's door - but he is reluctant to attend because he believes the five-yearly event always coincides with a disastrous downturn in his fortunes. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles is happy for his father to move in with him - especially once he finds out Daphne will be coming too. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney, Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Alex and Jacqui MacPherson, from Eastbourne, East Sussex, plan to head to warmer climes to enjoy their retirement. They're looking for a home in the Tampa area of Florida where they can spend the winter months, so Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners in Nottinghamshire take part in the dinner party competition, hoping to secure the £1,000 prize. First to host are Kev and Chelsey, who reckon their menu of luxury cuisine will win over their guests - but they are alarmed when everyone asks for their expensive steaks to be `well-done'. Next, 1940s obsessives Jayne and Ricky throw a Second World War-themed bash, before Louise and Mark are let down by some culinary mishaps in the final dinner party.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwicks in London, Nathan John Finch and Debs Franklin are doing deals on a pair of original fish paintings and an original theatre organ with a £35,000 asking price.(n)

programme.desc: Words-and-numbers game, presented by Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley, with Dan Walker joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Retired engineer Barry and his Maltese-born partner Pauline search for a property in Suffolk, on a budget of £425,000. Presented by David Bull and Kirsty Duffy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week comes from the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich, Kent, with hosts Jan and Les Fisher convinced their traditional place will impress the others.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts the third party of the week in Nottingham, but tensions as car-salesman Alistair continues to poke fun at 57-year-old Lesley.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer bowls a perfect 300 game and becomes a local hero, giving speeches to classes of schoolchildren and appearing on TV show Springfield Squares - but it is not long before fame goes to his head. With the voices of Penn & Teller and Ron Howard.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna wants Warren to be more involved in her pre-natal routine, and James checks if Warren has changed his mind on the child arrangement order, but Sienna spots them together and becomes suspicious.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers who are struggling to find homes. In Southampton, Jenny and Tom are keen to move out of their cramped rental property and into a house of their own, but they are facing fierce competition and a fast market. Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: New series. The black comedy drama inspired by the Coen brothers' Oscar-winning film returns, this time set in 2010. Parole officer Ray Stussy wants to marry his girlfriend and goes to ask his successful businessman brother Emmit for money to buy a ring, but he refuses and sparks a chain of events that plunges the Minnesota town into chaos, with police officer Gloria Burgle finding herself at the heart of it. Ewan McGregor stars as both Stussy brothers, with Carrie Coon, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition explores the challenges that inevitably come with the end of life, and how the emergency services have to learn to cope when dealing with death on a daily basis. In Warrington, paramedics arrive at the home of a man having a suspected cardiac arrest, and with CPR already being carried out and a defibrillator at close hand, the man is given the best possible chance of survival. Plus, ambulance staff and police officers discuss being called to sudden deaths.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Wolverhampton DJ Darryl hopes stripping everything back will him meet his ideal partner, while former ballet dancer Ania, from Preston, is tired of investing valuable time on people only to be disappointed when the clothes come off and has decided that being upfront is the key to relationship success. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo
programme.desc: A lowly fish-tank cleaner working at a gigolo's luxurious house has his eyes opened to a completely new way of life - but an accident with his employer's prized pets puts him into a tricky situation. Desperate to raise a quick buck, he is soon entertaining a series of increasingly sex-crazed women. Comedy, starring Rob Schneider, William Forsythe, Eddie Griffin, Oded Fehr and Gail O'Grady.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were expecting babies when they first met him. In 2009, Rik and Helen Francis wanted to change their city-centre living in Manchester for a move to a family home in Hale and Altrincham. In 2004, Alison and Phil Clarke were hoping to move from Bolton to Herefordshire to be nearer their relatives.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three rival sellers in the London suburb of Bromley take design ideas from Amanda Lamb on how to improve their homes to clinch a sale from buyer Tim. First they snoop around each other's houses in search of inspiration, then they have £1000 and a week to make changes. Hannah and Gordon need to spruce up their garden, Caroline and Jan attempt to bring a country cottage style to their dining room, and David and Wendy add colour to their shabby semi. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Phil calls on his old friend Kevin to help transport a batch of delicate fairy-tale cakes and a giant chair valued at £10,000 to the set of BBC One's The Great British Bake Off.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will finds it hard to break up with a boyfriend because he likes his dog, and Karen resolves to stop Grace falling for her nephew. Comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Poker? I Don't Even Like Her.
programme.desc: Will's friends urge him to tell Grace she cannot play poker with them any more, so she hatches a plan for one last big game. Karen convinces an acquaintance to be a guinea pig for the new shoulder implants she is considering.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray goes to a father-daughter dance and ends up reminiscing about events leading up to Ally's birth. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Madylin Sweeten.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and the family attend an open day at the twins' school, during which first-grader Michael shocks and embarrasses them by reading out a story obviously based on their constant bickering.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier fail dismally in their bid to get tickets for a popular new theatre production, while Daphne achieves the dubious distinction of having a photograph of her bottom appear in a Seattle newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin decides to set Frasier up with Duke's beautiful daughter Marie, but it soon becomes clear she is only interested in him because she needs a psychiatrist and does not want to pay for one. Guest starring Teri Hatcher (Desperate Housewives).(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Maris tries to woo Niles with anonymous presents, but Frasier thinks the gifts were intended for him and risks his latest relationship to learn the identity of his secret admirer. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Later, young newlyweds Lauren and Pete shock their guests with a mature and refined menu, while Karl and Mukta serve up Indian-themed dishes alongside a few surprises.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and Ellie Beardmore look at a dazzling diamond-encrusted mobile phone, a rare German clock, a stunning diamond cluster ring and a solid silver Rococo-style bowl.
