Bren's romance with Tony is ruined by the unexpected reappearance of her husband, and Anita goes away - but leaves her inflatable man behind. Festive special from 1999, starring Victoria Wood.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?.
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: When Ben and Susan discover Michael has been seeing a therapist, they are prompted to undertake a spot of self-analysis. Domestic comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker as harassed parents.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan's new plasma TV gives him the perfect opportunity to invite his friends round to enjoy the Pakistan versus England cricket match. The only problem is, Mrs Khan plans to host a prayer meeting for her recently widowed friend, and needs complete calm in the house. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Sketches include the Fat Sweaty Coppers, Unlucky Alf, Arthur Atkinson and Bob Fleming the coughing TV sensation.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark waits anxiously at the hospital for the birth of his child, with Sophie determined to have a natural delivery. Jeremy is convinced he will never get over losing Elena, until he meets Zahra, whose boyfriend is in a coma. Comedy, starring David Mitchell, Olivia Colman and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: Skits and sketches, including a spoof of Pulp Fiction. Guest starring Kate Moss and Lulu.(n)

programme.title: You, Me & Them
programme.desc: Ed and Clive head out for a night of bonding at a snooker tournament, but their plans are scuppered when a ghost from Lauren's past returns. Comedy, starring Anthony Head, Jeff Rawle and Eve Myles.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: Classic clips, skits and quips from previous series, including the Amish version of TV Burp, Strictly Come Dancing launching a craze for playing a woman's leg like a guitar, and Ray Mears going walkabout - in a car. Plus, Harry is struck down with `Brucie Syndrome' and Dermot O'Leary drops by to give the big-collared comedian a hug.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: The big-collared comedian looks back at classic clips, skits and quips from previous series. This week's pick features Rachel Stevens `shaking like a leaflet' on Strictly Come Dancing and an Emu puppet with a striking resemblance to Coronation Street's Gail Platt harassing Harry. TV Burp favourites Bear Grylls, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Hole in the Wall also receive a gentle ribbing.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Holiday antics with 1970s pop group Slade on a camping trip, and a special edition of MasterChef. Plus, the Bra Men take a walk around an art gallery and Bob gets stuck in a glass jar.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob present more offbeat humour in their various guises. Councillors Cox and Evans put forward another of their outlandish proposals, the Bra Men get up to a bit of jiggery-pokery and Sting is invited to chat with Donald and Davey Stott.(n)

programme.desc: Martin gets trapped between the joists in a loft while spending a weekend in a country cottage - and is eventually obliged to call Paul to his rescue. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time.
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan decides she wants to get a dog, but her penchant for pooches creates plenty of trouble for Ben. Comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Shazia is looking forward to having fun with her friends as the day of her hen party arrives, only for a few unwelcome guests to tag along - and she ends up being bombarded with everyone's stories of married life. Meanwhile, Amjad has his stag do, which is being organised by his future father-in-law Mr Khan, so surely nothing can go wrong. Back at the house, the groom is put in a compromising position - and when the two parties collide, the wedding is left hanging in the balance. Kate Robbins guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Sketches include the Fat Sweaty Coppers, Unlucky Alf, Arthur Atkinson and Bob Fleming the coughing TV sensation.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: The object of Mark's desire, Dobby, goes out with a graphic designer, leaving him no choice but to form a club with Gerrard devoted to winning her over. Elsewhere, Zahra's boyfriend Ben, now back from hospital, offers Jeremy the job as head of development for his music website, but things take a turn for the worse when he signs up Super Hans's band Man Feelings. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Grand Theatre in Swansea, South Wales. Sean Lock heads the showcase of stand-ups from the comedy circuit, with support from Steve Williams, Ava Vidal and Alun Cochrane.(n)

programme.title: The Full Monty
programme.desc: Six unemployed men from Sheffield decide to become strippers for one night only in a bid to raise extra money. However, with no dancing experience and far from perfect physiques, the men rely on the unique selling point of complete nudity to impress the punters. Comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Tom Wilkinson, Hugo Speer and Paul Barber.(n)

En el corazón de la tormenta

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Donut Showdown
programme.desc: Canada-based bakers test their creativity and culinary skills in a series of challenges as they compete against one another to make the best doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes for a fete, including chocolate, toffee and peanut squares, lemon cake, and brown scones with treacle and sesame seeds. She also visits an artisan chocolate-maker and gives members of the Irish Countrywoman's Association a sample of her scones.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off: The Final.
programme.desc: Three contestants remain and only one more weekend of baking stands between them and the 2014 title. Judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry have saved their most fiendish tests till last, as the finalists face a Signature Challenge in which they have just three hours to prove they have mastered a pastry technique that usually takes a whole day. They then have to tackle a Technical Challenge without the aid of a recipe, before rustling up a Showstopper that turns sponge, caramel, choux pastry and petits fours into a winning combination. At least Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc are on hand to lighten the atmosphere if it all gets too tense.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The week's first heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a signature dish that showcases what they can do, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four contenders try to impress Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace by preparing mille feuille with creme patissiere and raspberries, and then Marcus Wareing gives them 60 minutes to cook a spectacular lamb dish. Finally, Marcus and Monica decide which three will make it through to the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The duo arrive in Italy, where they abandon their hogs for the gondolas of Venice, and bake a classic focaccia by the side of a canal. They later visit Si King's sister, who lives in Tuscany, and savour a pasta pie in the back streets of Ferrara. There then follows a dash for Turin to help celebrate the country's 150th birthday, a visit to a hazelnut farm to learn the secrets of a certain chocolate spread and the chance to re-create big-screen movie The Italian Job on the rooftop of the old Fiat factory.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of recipes for a romantic dinner, including spicy squid salad, pan-fried chicken with mango salsa, and a chocolate mousse cake. Rachel also visits the English market in Cork, and a group of school-run mothers try one of her recipes.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The TV chef provides recipes for chicken noodle soup, fast prawn red curry, and cardamom and coconut panna cotta. The local lifeboat crew also tests out a dish while Rachel meets her favourite chicken farmer.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: After 10 weeks of stiff competition, calm finally descends on the Bake Off tent as judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry take up the reins to demonstrate how they would have tackled the contest's signature, technical and showstopper challenges had the roles been reversed. They begin with tasks from the first two weeks of the series, with Paul making a blackcurrant and liquorice Swiss roll and two types of savoury biscuits, while Mary prepares a cherry cake with lemon icing, Florentines and miniature classic coffee and walnut cakes.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The week's second heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a plate of food that showcases their culinary skills, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four try to impress Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace by preparing a dish featuring whelks and winkles, after which Marcus Wareing asks them to make a spectacular chocolate dessert. Marcus and Monica then decide which three have earned a place in the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of Si King and Dave Myers' European baking tour takes them to France. Travelling from Lyon to Carcassonne, they learn the secrets of teeth-pulling nougat, go truffle hunting and meet up with Dave's old flatmate, whom he has not seen for 30 years. Culinary delights en route include tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson begins with her take on a classic yoghurt pot cake, which was inspired by a scribbled note she found in an old Italian kitchen. The food writer's niece and nephew are recruited to make - and enjoy - a sausage meatball supper, while a girls' night in sees her rustling up squid and prawns with marjoram and chilli. The show ends with Nigella's `tiramisini' - a lighter, quicker version of a traditional tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

The food writer's niece and nephew are recruited to make - and enjoy - a sausage meatball supper, while a girls' night in sees her rustling up squid and prawns with marjoram and chilli. The show ends with Nigella's `tiramisini' - a lighter, quicker version of a traditional tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: After 10 weeks of stiff competition, calm finally descends on the Bake Off tent as judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry take up the reins to demonstrate how they would have tackled the contest's signature, technical and showstopper challenges had the roles been reversed. They begin with tasks from the first two weeks of the series, with Paul making a blackcurrant and liquorice Swiss roll and two types of savoury biscuits, while Mary prepares a cherry cake with lemon icing, Florentines and miniature classic coffee and walnut cakes.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The week's second heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a plate of food that showcases their culinary skills, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four try to impress Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace by preparing a dish featuring whelks and winkles, after which Marcus Wareing asks them to make a spectacular chocolate dessert. Marcus and Monica then decide which three have earned a place in the next round.(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two neighbours, who have been bitter rivals ever since a youthful feud over a woman, renew their animosity when an attractive widow moves in across the street. The new arrival is a welcome diversion for the old adversaries, and when they both attempt to woo her, only one can win her affections. When it becomes clear that the widow is interested only in commitment and her new lover has other ideas, she begins to doubt her original decision(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: An apartment block janitor discovers a magical woman in the swimming pool, who tells him that she has come from a children's fairytale and needs his help to return home. But something dangerous lurks in the woods as the story begins to take over the lives of the characters(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two neighbours, who have been bitter rivals ever since a youthful feud over a woman, renew their animosity when an attractive widow moves in across the street. The new arrival is a welcome diversion for the old adversaries, and when they both attempt to woo her, only one can win her affections. When it becomes clear that the widow is interested only in commitment and her new lover has other ideas, she begins to doubt her original decision(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 05/23/2017. Segments include a report on abuse in youth soccer programs in England; a profile of the Dodgers' Spanish broadcaster Jaime Jarrin; and a visit with Robert Gagno, the autistic defending winner of the World Pinball Championships(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Based on the life of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens, who became the greatest track and field athlete in history at the world stage of the 1936 Olympics by winning four gold medals. He achieved this amazing feat under the gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 141. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.sub-title: The Most Powerful Man in the World (and His Identical Twin Brother)
programme.desc: The Most Powerful Man in the World (and His Identical Twin Brother). Kevin's mission of mercy finds him assuming an alternate identity(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Customer Service. A hunt for financial support takes Richard outside the tech bubble, where he encounters a contentious figure from Pied Piper's past(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Boris Epshteyn; Neil deGrasse Tyson; David Frum; Cornel West
programme.desc: Boris Epshteyn; Neil deGrasse Tyson; David Frum; Cornel West. Political strategist Boris Epshteyn and astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson are the interview guests. The panelists are Atlantic editor David Frum and scholar Cornel West(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: The discovery of marital troubles in her well-to-do Jewish family causes a young woman to question her own upcoming nuptials(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: John Travolta gives a charming performance in this comic fantasy. Unshaven, chain-smoking archangel Michael (Travolta) is discovered in an elderly woman's home by a group of cynical tabloid writers, who resolve to prove his existence to the world. Their cross-country journey becomes a quest for both redemption and love. Andie MacDowell, William Hurt, Bob Hoskins. Directed by Nora Ephron(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: John Cusack and Kate Beckinsale decide to let fate be their guide in this charming comedy about a man and woman who share an undeniable attraction when they meet, but concoct a series of experiments to determine if they are truly meant for each other. Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: Larry Kramer in Love and Anger
programme.desc: A profile of Larry Kramer, a dedicated activist and controversial writer who helped raise awareness of the AIDS crisis in the 1980s and change the way the U.S. government and the medical community responded to it after years of inaction(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Warning: This Drug May Kill You
programme.desc: A look at opioid addiction in the U.S. profiles four families whose lives have been decimated by drug abuse that began with legitimate prescriptions to dangerous painkillers that are often a gateway to heroin(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

Eager to avoid the media's glare, the duo flee to the French Riviera to get away from it all. Directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The youngest child of the family often has the most problems -- so why should things be different for the Prince of Darkness and his offspring? Satan (Harvey Keitel) is considering retirement, and is pondering which of his sons should take over the family business -- ambitious Adrian (Rhys Ifans), strapping Cassius (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.), or Nicky (Adam Sandler), an accident-prone demon who prefers to stay in his room playing his favorite heavy metal tunes. When Satan decides to stay on for another 10,000 years, Adrian is outraged, and leaves Hell to go to New York, where he and Cassius attempt to round up enough souls to vote Satan out of power. Satan, understandably upset, sends Nicky to bring Adrian and Cassius back home, but Nicky finds life on Earth is more complicated than he expected. Things don't get any easier when he develops a crush on Valerie (Patricia Arquette), a good-hearted mortal woman. Little Nicky also features Michael McKean as a city official trying to put Nicky behind bars, Kevin Nealon as Hell's gatekeeper, Rodney Dangerfield as Satan's father, Robert Smigel as the voice of Beefy -- a talking dog who is Nicky's guide on earth, Allen Covert as Todd -- Nicky's new roommate, and Peter Dante and Jonathan Loughran as a pair of metalheads who dig Satan. Jon Lovitz and Reese Witherspoon play cameo roles, and Regis Philbin and Ozzy Osbourne appear as themselves(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Alien: Covenant'
programme.desc: A look at "Alien: Covenant," a 2017 sci-fi thriller about a spaceship crew that encounters dangerous creatures while exploring a seemingly idyllic world. The film stars Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston and Billy Crudup, and is directed by Ridley Scott(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: A former child actor turned talent agent is hired to find a young girl to appear in a national advertisement. During his search, he discovers a charming young pickpocket who renews his interest in his career and his love of life in this light, sentimental comedy(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: A madcap brain surgeon, married to a beautiful but evil woman, falls in love with the brain of another lady who has everything he wants - except a body(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: Ellen DeGeneres: The Beginning
programme.desc: Perhaps best-known for "coming out" to American audiences on her sitcom Ellen in 1997, Ellen Degeneres has been a force in comedy for many years. This film profiles her return to stand-up comedy in New York. This HBO special finds the talented comedian musing on subjects from sex to fashion and friends(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie is seeing his single friends get married one by one. Not something he's worried about, until his current girlfriend Anne catches the bouquet at his friend Marco's wedding. Feeling his wild partying days are numbered, he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town, insulted by his apparently defeatist attempt to tie the knot. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day! Can he beat the clock in time to claim his inheritance?(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn

Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. programme.desc: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens a 14-year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past. Taken in by the intelligent and independent Boatwright sisters, Lily finds solace in their mesmerizing world of beekeeping(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures

programme.title: New Best Friend
programme.desc: Tense drama about a deputy sheriff investigating the drug overdose of a poor girl who fell in with the rich crowd as part of a class experiment at a prestigious Southern university. But the lawman finds that everyone who knew her has a different tale of her predicament(n)

programme.title: King Ralph
programme.desc: Sometimes a family title, among the nobility of England, goes to the "collateral" heirs -- people not in the direct line of decent, like cousins, great-nephews and the like. On rare occasions, these people are not even aware that they are about to be elevated to the House of Lords, and they have been living more-or-less ordinary lives. In this comedy, the family which lacks direct heirs is the Royal Family of England -- as all of the likely heirs have died one after the other in swift succession. In this comedy, the "collateral heir" is an exuberant, fence-busting All-American slob (and pretty good rock n' roll musician) by the name of Ralph (John Goodman). Unknown to him, his grandmother had an affair with a royal prince. Ralph's a good guy, and eager to please. He recognizes the importance of the royal hoopla to England and works very hard to fit in as its new designated king. He is assisted by the ever-unctuous, very serious family factotum Willingham (Peter O'Toole). The trouble is, he doesn't have instincts for politics English-style, and he is constantly "putting a foot wrong," as they might say. The most difficult situation for him is when he develops a new love interest, and she's not "acceptable" to the upper crust. In addition to being hounded by the tabloids, he finds that "the good of the state" requires that he drop his new girlfriend. Things really come to a head just before Ralph's coronation as king. Reviewers generally loathed this feel-good comedy, but audiences seem to have enjoyed it tremendously, and it has done well in video and TV airings(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as Joel Goodson, a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up a glamorous hooker. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Joel's house, she has an idea: seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: NewZealandTown. The prime minister of New Zealand wants to create 'New Zealand Town' in the bit between Chinatown and Little Italy. The boys want to play at the grand opening but he wants someone more cool - so Murray gets hold of some hair gel(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him in the middle of the Pacific. An elemental drama of hope and survival(n)

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: Sociopathic death-row inmate Jerico Stewart (Kevin Costner) is implanted with the memories of a deceased CIA agent (Ryan Reynolds) in a desperate attempt to thwart a deadly plot involving a Dutch hacker (Michael Pitt). At the same time, Jerico reconnects with his own humanity as he bonds with the late agent's family. Gary Oldman, Tommy Lee Jones, and Gal Gadot co-star in this espionage thriller directed by Ariel Vromen (The Iceman)(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: Tris and Four journey beyond the wall surrounding Chicago, and get caught up in a battle for the fate of humanity(n)

programme.title: Terminal Velocity
programme.desc: A skydiving instructor is plunged into a web of deception and espionage when one of his students dies in a freefalling accident(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In desperate need of a vacation after being unceremoniously dumped by his TV-star girlfriend, a man travels to a lavish Hawaiian resort to nurse his wounds and forget his heartache, only to discover that his ex and her handsome new boyfriend are currently staying at the exact same island hot spot. Peter Bretter (Jason Segel) may be just another struggling musician, but for the past six years he's been dating Sarah Marshall (Kristen Bell), one of the hottest stars on television. Sarah is everything in the world to Peter, so when she kindly but firmly tells him that they should each go their separate ways, he is absolutely devastated. Later, after attempting to salvage his ego by awkwardly attempting to become a womanizer and nearly losing his job because of a nervous breakdown, an emotionally fragile Peter attempts to put the past behind him by escaping to the sun-soaked beaches of Oahu. While at first it seems as if Peter has discovered the perfect prescription for a bad case of lost love, his plan soon turns to dust when Sarah and her new rock-star boyfriend, Aldous (Russell Brand), turn up at the exact same resort. Though accepting Sarah's lavish new lifestyle won't be easy for the crestfallen Peter, the laid-back companionship of flirtatious resort employee Rachel (Mila Kunis) -- not to mention a continuous regimen of fruity cocktails -- goes a long way in mending the wounds of a broken heart. Forgetting Sarah Marshall was penned by Segel and produced by Judd Apatow. Fun with Dick and Jane screenwriter Nicholas Stoller makes his directorial debut. The cast also includes Paul Rudd, Bill Hader, Jack McBrayer, and Jonah Hill(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: The Quest

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: This powerful drama follows the fate of four young altar boys in 1960s New York, whose childish prank goes tragically wrong. Sentenced to several arduous months in a reform school, the boys suffer unimaginable abuse at the hands of sadistic guard Sean Nokes (Kevin Bacon) and his cohorts, abuse which is to scar them mentally for the rest of their lives. As adults, the four - Michael (Brad Pitt), Lorenzo (Jason Patric), Tommy (Billy Crudup) and John (Ron Eldard) - are unable to escape from their past and, when an unexpected chance for revenge presents itself, Tommy and John make full use of it. Now the heavy hand of the law is about to come down on the four men once again and only their old Father (Robert De Niro) and a shifty lawyer (Dustin Hoffman) may be able to save them(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Jason Bourne'

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: The people of Covington, a small town in rural Pennsylvania lead peaceful lives, only rarely disturbed by the creatures that inhabit the woods surrounding the village. An agreement has been reached with the creatures and peace prevails under the condition that the boundaries are respected. Yet this balance is disrupted when Lucius Hunt (Joaquin Phoenix), an inquisitive and willful young man, ventures himself beyond the limits of the village. After this, things will never be the same. Written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan, this is his third film after the huge success of The Sixth Sense(n)

programme.title: Funny Games
programme.desc: Michael Haneke's American re-make of his 1997 German version loses none of the terror or horror in the translation. An all-American family - George, Ann and son Georgie - arrive at their summer cottage for a yachting holiday. Two polite young men, Paul and Peter introduce themselves as neighbours but suddenly and brutally instil a nihilistic, sadistic regime on the family, playing mind games and torturing them. Haneke famously makes the audience complicit to events, rewinding events, having Paul and Peter address the audience directly and making the violence happen off screen but having it still horribly audible in this claustrophobic nightmare(n)

programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Game Show. Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is reunited with his former father-in-law Dwight Ellison (Bob Gunton), the producer of the popular TV game show "Treasure Chest." Convinced that the game's current champion Val Birch (Larry Brandenberg) is cheating, Ellison asks Monk to investigate. The solution to the mystery rests in the fact that "Treasure Chest" host Roddy Lankman (John Michael Higgins) has recently murdered his personal assistant--but Monk will only be able to crack the case if he becomes a contestant himself. This episode introduces Jarrad Paul as Monk's obnoxious upstairs neighbor Kevin Dorfman, and, in a flashback sequence, Melora Hardin as Monk's late wife Trudy (a role previously essayed by Stella Rusich)(n)

Before long, strange things begin happening, convincing the townsfolk that Mariah is not merely acting, but is in truth the reincarnation of the notorious witch. programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Takes His Medicine. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Monk

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk vs. The Cobra. Author John Ricca (Harry Groener) is murdered, apparently for writing a nasty, warts-and-all biography of legendary Kung Fu movie star Sonny "The Cobra" Chow. In the course of his investigation, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) gathers evidence which seems to indicate beyond doubt that Ricca was murdered by Sonny Chow himself. But this theory may not hold up in court: Sonny Chow has been dead for six years! Before this baffling case is solved, Monk has a too-close-for-comfort confrontation with the real killer, and ends up being buried alive--a grisly fate by anyone's standards, but especially so for a man with a crippling fear of both dirt and the dark(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A New Hope. It must be 1977: everyone is going to see Star Wars, including our friends from That '70s Show. Kelso (Ashton Kutcher) is so fascinated by the film that he sees it again and again and again -- even turning down an opportunity for a "golden moment" with Jackie (Mila Kunis). In other disturbances in the Force, Donna (Laura Prepon) finds herself the romantic bone of contention between Eric (Topher Grace) and his old friend David (Scott Whyte) -- who happens to be the son of Red's (Kurtwood Smith) new boss -- and Laurie (Lisa Robin Kelly) is driven to a rash act out of sheer boredom(n)

programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: "In space, no one can hear you scream." A close encounter of the third kind becomes a Jaws-style nightmare when an alien invades a spacecraft in Ridley Scott's sci-fi horror classic. On the way home from a mission for the Company, the Nostromo's crew is woken up from hibernation by the ship's Mother computer to answer a distress signal from a nearby planet. Capt. Dallas's (Tom Skerritt) rescue team discovers a bizarre pod field, but things get even stranger when a face-hugging creature bursts out of a pod and attaches itself to Kane (John Hurt). Over the objections of Ripley (Sigourney Weaver), science officer Ash (Ian Holm) lets Kane back on the ship. The acid-blooded incubus detaches itself from an apparently recovered Kane, but an alien erupts from Kane's stomach and escapes. The alien starts stalking the humans, pitting Dallas and his crew (and cat) against a malevolent killing machine that also has a protector in the nefarious Company(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: James Cameron took the helm for this frightening sequel, with Sigourney Weaver reprising her role as Ellen Ripley. After 57 years in deep sleep Ripley is rescued from the escape capsule of the starship Nostromo, the sole survivor of the alien attack. Back on Earth, she finds that the planet where she and her late crewmates first made contact has since been colonised, but all communication has been lost. Persuaded that the mission is to destroy the aliens, Ripley joins a group of marines sent to investigate. Inside the colonists' complex, they discover a terrified girl, Newt who reveals the truth; a group of aliens are using the human hosts to incubate. With most of the marines killed, Corporal Hicks takes charge and decides to nuke the planet. But when their shuttlecraft crashes, the survivors find shelter and and must hope their mother ship will pick them up before the raging fires consume the planet and cause a nuclear explosion..(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Sigourney Weaver returns as Ripley in the third instalment of the series, as her escape pod (from the end of Aliens) crash lands on a penal planet. The crew and Newt are killed in the crash and Ripley, alone again, must convince both the prison staff and the prisoners that something alien has joined them. It's only when the killings begin that the prisoners believe Ripley's tale and join her in the battle for survival(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh

Whoever wins each round gets first choice in The Masterpiece Challenge, a room filled with antiques, one of which is worth more than £10,000. At the end of the show each team reveals what its members think is the masterpiece and whoever chooses the most masterpieces wins £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast

programme.desc: Carly is shocked when Matt tells her that he loves her, and asks her to run away with him. programme.title: The Keith and Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness continue to put their unique stamp on classic Hollywood films via star-studded remakes. This week, they turn their attention to the concluding instalment of the original Star Wars trilogy, Return of the Jedi. Former Coronation Street star Michelle Keegan fills in for Carrie Fisher as Princess Leia, while Ant and Dec follow in Warwick Davis's footsteps as Ewoks. Phillip Schofield waxes philosophical as the swamp-dwelling mystic Yoda, and David Dickinson shrouds himself in darkness as the evil Emperor. Keith himself becomes the heroic Luke Skywalker, while Paddy takes over from Harrison Ford as the smooth-talking space-rogue Han Solo.(n)

Starring Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Robert Daws, and featuring a guest appearance by Tricia Penrose in her Heartbeat guise of Gina Ward.(n)

programme.desc: The increasing elephant population presents Danny with a problem, but Mara's new owner Elliot Kriel offers a solution. Du Plessis is thrilled when his son Kirk brings news that his girlfriend Neema is pregnant, but his joy is short-lived when the couple announce their future plans - and the soon-to-be grandfather seeks solace in the bottle. A hen party of excitable young women, the first guests of the luxury lodge, proves invaluable when a group of rich, demanding bankers causes trouble. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuth's passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective and his team embark on a race against time to recapture a dangerous convict who has escaped from Bodmin prison - a case that leads them to an elaborate drugs racket. Starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Jimmy Yuill and Sean Chapman.(n)

programme.title: The Knock
programme.desc: Successful smuggler John Danson is under pressure from the East German secret police, while a US dollar counterfeit plate is seized and traced back to master forger Donald Dewhurst. With special guests Dennis Waterman and Colin Baker.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The Annual Busmen's Ball arrives, and Jack arranges a stripper as part of the entertainment. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The increasing elephant population presents Danny with a problem, but Mara's new owner Elliot Kriel offers a solution. Du Plessis is thrilled when his son Kirk brings news that his girlfriend Neema is pregnant, but his joy is short-lived when the couple announce their future plans - and the soon-to-be grandfather seeks solace in the bottle. A hen party of excitable young women, the first guests of the luxury lodge, proves invaluable when a group of rich, demanding bankers causes trouble. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Felix gets a job working for Mr Tremayne at the hotel, but when he finds a dinner service with a royal crest on it, he suspects his new employer of stealing it.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A racehorse trainer asks Holmes to investigate the mysterious disappearance of one of his cash-strapped employer's many creditors. Victorian whodunit, starring Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke, with a young Jude Law in an early supporting role.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A magistrate does his best to protect a young troublemaker - until an embarrassing connection between the two comes to light. The village mourns the death of Dr Summerbee, who is temporarily replaced by James Alway, while Vernon wonders if he may regret an offer to help old flame Maggie Byrne. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A student nurse causes quite a stir when she arrives in the middle of the night, while Ken and Alun contend with a farming family suffering a crisis. Brigid and Jill deliver a Down's syndrome baby whose parents don't want anything to do with it, and Lizzie's crash diet has alarming consequences. Starring Wendy Craig, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny is shocked when an old flame from veterinary college unexpectedly turns up with a tranquillised lioness, which she claims to have found in the Bush. Meanwhile, Du Plessis volunteers to purchase more prey animals for the newly merged reserve, but has an ulterior motive for attending the auction, and Sarah struggles to maintain order when she takes over Evan's class. Guest starring Maggie O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A woman arrives at the depot to claim her lost property, but Stan and Jack have already eaten it. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.desc: Stan gets a new uniform and is proud to wear it - until he sits on a freshly painted chair. Classic comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.desc: Ivy and Billy enter a competition to write an article about their profession, and learn that truth is stranger than fiction.(n)

programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the murder of her old friend Father Gorman, using a list of names sent by the priest moments before his death to bring the guilty party to justice. Following a trail of clues to London, Marple is drawn to the Pale Horse Inn - where she discovers a sinister world of occult practices. Drama, starring Julia McKenzie in the title role, with Lynda Baron, Pauline Collins, Nicholas Parsons and Neil Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspected kidnapping and gets his first lead when a ransom note is discovered. The missing woman then turns up dead at the wheel of a crashed car, smelling of alcohol. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur looks forward to a big payout when an ex-con needs his help to recover the loot from a robbery committed 14 years earlier - but learns banks are not always as safe as they seem. Vintage comedy drama, guest starring Rula Lenska, Maurice Denman and Max Wall.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: The incomparable comedian performs a variety of sketches and magic tricks, joined by husky-voiced actress Joan Greenwood.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: The Perfect Lap.
programme.desc: Profiles of past and present lap record-holders on the Isle of Man TT's mountain course, including John Surtees, Mick Grant, Carl Fogarty and John McGuinness.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.desc: Ned Boulting presents action from the 10th and final round of the series, which took place on a course in the centre of the Hertfordshire town of Stevenage.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the fourth day's play at Roland Garros in Paris, featuring the opening matches in the second round of the men's and women's singles. Andy Murray continued to do things the hard way at this stage last year, coming through a second successive five-setter by eventually defeating unheralded home wildcard Mathias Bourgue 6-2, 2-6, 4-6, 6-2, 6-3, Meanwhile, 2015 champion Stan Wawrinka beat Taro Daniel 7-6, 6-3, 6-4, before home favourite Richard Gasquet beat Bjorn Fratangelo 6-1, 7-6, 6-3. In the women's competition, eventual title-winner Garbine Muguruza comfortably overcame Myrtille Georges 6-2, 6-0, and there were also straight-set victories for 2014 runner-up Simona Halep, double Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova and second seed Agnieszka Radwanska against Zarina Diyas, Hsieh Su-wei and Caroline Garcia respectively. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: My Greatest Moment.
programme.desc: A selection of the greatest moments in the history of the Isle of Man TT. Presented by Craig Doyle, with Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: World Superbike Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the sixth round of the season, held at Donington Park.(n)

programme.title: World Rugby U20 Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Richard Henwood presents action from the opening fixtures at the tournament in Georgia, including England v Samoa, New Zealand v Scotland, Ireland v Italy and Australia v Wales.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Riggs and Murtaugh investigate a series of violent crimes with one thing in common - the victims are all members of the same church. Gareth Hunt and Alfie Bass guest star, with George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the fifth day of the second Grand Slam tournament of the year at Roland Garros, where the second-round matches are scheduled to conclude. Top seeds Novak Djokovic and Serena Williams recorded straight-sets victories over Steve Darcis and Teliana Pereira respectively at this stage in 2016, but while Djokovic will be looking to emulate his triumph last year, Williams was not among the entries this year as she is expecting her first child. Rafael Nadal was also in top form as he dispatched Facundo Bagnis 6-3, 6-0, 6-3, but was forced to withdraw due to injury before his third-round match. This time around, he will be hoping to build on his second place in January's Australian Open, his best performance in a Grand Slam since 2013, and claim this title for a record 10th time. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: Preview Show.
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents a look ahead to the Isle of Man TT races that get under way on Saturday, meeting the leading contenders. With analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: TT Blues
programme.desc: The work of the Isle of Man Constabulary during the world famous TT races. Residents and officers work together to prepare the island for the TT fortnight. German cops Evald and Ralf arrive to give this small force a helping hand, while neighbourhood officers Kirsty Bowley and Stuart McLean unearth some drugs, and traffic cop Wayne Softley faces a tough challenge at a mountain crash. Meanwhile, clerk of the course Gary Thompson battles to get a race away on time.(n)

programme.title: Halloween H20
programme.desc: Homicidal madman Michael Myers returns to stalk his original target, now an alcoholic teacher, 20 years after his first killing spree, and ends up terrorising a group of teenagers in a deserted school. Horror sequel, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, Josh Hartnett and Michelle Williams.(n)

Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham and Adrian Lukis star.(n)

Meanwhile, Kate gets a final warning after leaving a patient choking, and David makes plans for a party in celebration of his move into surgery. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass starts a devious plot involving the postal service, much to Blaketon's annoyance, and several people are suspected of attacking a TV repair man. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon as the pipe-smoking sleuth.(n)

programme.desc: Madeleine reluctantly begins re-examining her attitude to the Germans and Renard is arrested for an act of resistance, forcing him into a battle of wills with the secret police. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

Mike returns from London wanting his old job back, but walks straight into a fiery situation with Cathy, who's none too pleased to see him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Jewel Robbery at the Grand Metropolitan.
programme.desc: On doctor's orders, the dapper Belgian sleuth visits Brighton for what he hopes will be a relaxing holiday, but it leads to one of the most absorbing cases he has ever faced - the disappearance of a cache of jewels. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Hermione Norris, Philip Jackson and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook.
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: The mysterious Oz is brought into the station for questioning - but the suspect has been badly beaten, and hot-headed detective Gibbs is on the hook for the attack. The case takes an unexpected turn when another body is found in the canal, leaving Bradfield wondering whether they are looking at a double murder, while Tennison's integrity is tested when the DI asks her to make a decision that could have huge consequences for her career. Clifford Bentley and his sons start digging from the cafe to the bank, but they risk getting caught when David fails to notice the police outside.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The WI members of Great Paxford live under a shadow as the Battle of Britain looms on the horizon. Pat befriends a Czech soldier, but finds her newfound independence less enjoyable than expected. Laura faces the consequences of her affair, while Sarah receives some shocking news. Alison strikes a bargain with the police, and tragedy strikes for Frances.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A heartbroken Sidney agrees to help parishioner Isabel prepare for her wedding to Arthur, the new man in town, but the bride's stubborn mother, Daisy, proves to be a big impediment to the occasion as she believes the groom is out to kill her. When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. While the victim seems to have died of natural causes, Arthur and Isabel are pushing for a fast cremation, suggesting the couple have something to hide. Jean Marsh and Isla Blair guest star.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney is woken in the early hours by a fire in the village and, putting his life on the line, races to rescue Marion Taylor from the burning house, much to the relief of her husband Dominic. But there are questions surrounding the blaze - was it really an accident, and why was Marion so reluctant to leave? Normally Sidney would turn to Geordie to help solve a mystery like this, but he finds the detective is far from his usual self. When Dominic is then found stabbed to death, it's Geordie's junior, Atkins, who is sent to head up the case - and he's not exactly a fan of interfering vicars.(n)

programme.title: Gracepoint
programme.desc: The residents of Gracepoint turn their backs on Jack, but someone else seems to be hiding something. Meanwhile, Beth confronts Gemma. US-based remake of Broadchurch, starring David Tennant and Anna Gunn as detectives investigating the murder of a young boy, while locals in the victim's town come to terms with the horrific crime.(n)

programme.title: Maigret

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: As the German persecution of the Jews begins, Renard uses the annual procession of St Josse to register his disgust at the events taking place. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw, Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill, Bernd-Uwe Reppenhagen, Geoffrey Hutchings and Des McAleer.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Clare begins to lose her grip on reality altogether, while David has an unscheduled run-in with glamorous old flame Anna Bradshaw, and it isn't long before sparks are flying again - in more ways than one. Adrian Lukis, Caroline Langrishe and Gary Mavers star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Eternal bachelor Greengrass falls in love with an aristocratic lady poacher, and an old flame of Mike's turns up out of the blue to complicate his life. Rural capers, starring Nick Berry, Natasha Dahlberg and Frances de la Tour.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Two deadly incidents of racial hatred, more than 20 years apart, cause problems for Chief Constable Alan Cade. Martin Shaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine grows closer to Jack as her professional relationship with Robert continues to deteriorate, but is under no illusions about what her boss wants from her. Mike realises there are plenty more fish in the sea and vows to have a good time playing the field, and Kate's moonlighting gets her into trouble. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook.
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Crime drama following the personal and professional lives of two detectives working for a Manchester police unit that specialises in murder cases. DC Janet Scott (Lesley Sharp) and DC Rachel Bailey (Suranne Jones) investigate the case of a pregnant woman who was killed in her bedroom. Meanwhile, Rachel's love life takes a turn for the worse and Janet gets a call that reawakens a past tragedy. Also starring Rupert Graves, Amelia Bullmore and Nicholas Gleaves.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet reopens the investigation into the murder of childhood friend Veronica, Rachel receives news that makes her personal life even more complicated, and a teenage murderer is successfully charged, but horrific events start to unravel following his arrest. Crime drama, guest starring Sally Lindsay (Coronation Street), with Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators respond to reports of a large amount of dogs being held captive in makeshift pens, and Octavio Gonzales receives a call about an abandoned horse.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen saves 37 dogs from a fire, and rescue technician Roman Leal searches a drain for some stranded puppies.(n)

programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old nursing student Maura Murray, who went missing in February 2004 minutes after being involved in a traffic collision. For no apparent reason she had driven 144 miles north from her campus and the accident was the second road incident she had suffered within two days.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How stepbrothers Jamie McMahan and Chris Kauffman, responsible for a murder and robbery spree, were tracked down in Florida following a TV appeal for information.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of Angela, who fell in love soon after joining a dating site. A first date seemed to trouble her, and when she went out for a second time, she never returned.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The case of Rachel Anderson, a single mother apparently devoted to her children. When she disappeared investigators had to determine whether it was connected to terrifying phone calls she had been receiving.(n)

programme.desc: The investigation into 26-year-old Kim Medlin's mysterious disappearance. Secrets were revealed that shattered the safety of everyone in the town of Monroe, North Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The case of Jamie Laiaddee. Detectives were shocked it took 10 weeks for anyone to report him missing, but they soon uncovered dark secrets that Jamie kept from almost everyone.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigating the growing crime of letter-bombing in the USA, and exploring the techniques forensic lab technicians use to trace the perpetrators.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-two Nikki Whitehead, who was killed in her own home. Police suspected she may have known her killer, resorting to polygraphs and CCTV footage to help reveal the horrific truth.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
