programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: David and Gill and their son Freddie are hoping Noel Fitzpatrick can help their Labrador Scooby, who has a life-threatening tumour in his leg. The vet goes to extraordinary lengths to save the life of Tiger the cat after his heart stops during his recovery from an operation, and when a lurcher called Otis brought in with shotgun wounds, Noel must extract the bullet before working out how to save the animal's leg. Plus, will a pair of tights help a French bulldog walk again?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B veteran Paul Workman, who runs Hamlet House in Stratford-upon-Avon, makes the most of his town's Shakespeare connection as another round of the competition gets under way - but his guests cause a fuss when a hair is found in the mushrooms at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to B&B novices Ben Gray and Katie Keegan's Ashlack business in Cumbria. The guests admire rooms in the estate's 17th-century manor house, but Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud are unimpressed when they discover their accommodation is a yurt in the woods. Filled with dread at the idea of a midnight trip to the toilet facilities, they later make plain their feelings when checking out.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Richwood in Torquay, where partners Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud run the 13-bedroom guest house by themselves. The diners are given a crash course in belly-dancing and provided with a feast of Lebanese delicacies - but are soon distracted by the dated decor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Helen Fraser welcomes her guests to the Tai'r Bull Inn in the Brecon Beacons, with moral support from her friend Kath. Ben and Katie are quick to praise the quality of their lodgings, but B&B veteran Paul spots a few mistakes, while Saida and Veronica refuse to spend the night in their room after they make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. A clash then ensues between two of the week's hosts before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton goes house-hunting in Denia, on Spain's Costa Blanca, for a couple from Exeter who have a budget of £120,000 and want a property they can use for holidays and their eventual retirement.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Time Team: Secrets of a Tudor Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew visit Chenies Manor in Buckinghamshire to investigate how the house would have appeared in the 16th century when Henry VIII stayed there. An inventory from 1585 lists a host of rooms that are no longer in existence, and the experts' excavations reveal more than a few surprises for the property's current owners.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Nether Poppleton, Yorkshire: The Monastery and the Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Nether Poppleton near York in a bid to find out more about the village's origins. Residents are recruited to join in the excavations as the experts try to establish whether the settlement, mentioned in the Domesday Book as the land of St Everilda, dates back to the Anglo-Saxons.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick operates on a five-month-old rabbit with a badly broken hind leg and diagnoses that a much-loved cocker spaniel needs major spinal surgery. The `Bionic Vet' also meets young couple David and Khaya, who have brought in a three-legged dog that they adopted from Thailand after it was attacked with a machete. Noel knows he must come up with a radical treatment for the animal's remaining front paw, which is injured, and gains inspiration from X-Men's Wolverine for an innovative solution.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend lead a team of experts as they attempt to renovate a Volkswagen Beetle that has spent many years rusting in a garage.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stuart and Rosie Treasurer from the Wirral plan to transform a small bungalow from a 1960s dormer into a slick piece of 21st-century architecture. The couple decapitate the building and balance a new floating timber box on top to create five bedrooms, spending as little as possible on plumbing, electrics and insulation, but stress levels spiral when neighbours grumble at the ultra-modern creation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Chris Moller presents a look at innovative and unusual houses in Ponsonby, Auckland, and checks up on the progress of Sarah and Philippe Lods, who are building a modernist home.(n)

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans follows water-loving couple Shirley and Russ, who enjoy kayaking and living on their yacht. Now they want to join a large community of 600 floating homes in Canada, designing a luxury ranch-style home, including wraparound sundecks for year round entertaining, a bar area and pool table on the upper levels. Plus, adventurous retirees Glenn and Margaret build a nautical-themed floating home in a marina on Vancouver's north shore with stunning sea and mountain views, which will allow them to stay close to their family and friends, yet away from the hubbub of inner-city life.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous words-and-numbers quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by Miles Jupp and Greg Davies. Holly Walsh presides alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous words-and-numbers quiz, with regular team captain Sean Lock and guest captain Sarah Millican joined by Bob Mortimer and Katherine Ryan. Alex Horne and the Horne Section preside alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Chris Moller presents a look at innovative and unusual houses in Ponsonby, Auckland, and checks up on the progress of Sarah and Philippe Lods, who are building a modernist home.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. Mark Watson, Stephen Mangan, Daniel Sloss and Vanessa Feltz join team captains Sean Lock and Jason Manford to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick operates on a five-month-old rabbit with a badly broken hind leg and diagnoses that a much-loved cocker spaniel needs major spinal surgery. The `Bionic Vet' also meets young couple David and Khaya, who have brought in a three-legged dog that they adopted from Thailand after it was attacked with a machete. Noel knows he must come up with a radical treatment for the animal's remaining front paw, which is injured, and gains inspiration from X-Men's Wolverine for an innovative solution.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Robert Fox and his partner Kevin, who run Cherry Tree House in Blackpool, hope to be in with a chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, two guests are shocked at the room prices, and an afternoon learning clown skills sees a North-South divide develop in the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Caroline Middleton host at the Old Hall Inn in North Yorkshire, where a couple of guests are unimpressed by a discovery in their bathroom, and the afternoon's angling activity leaves two more frustrated when they fail to catch a fish.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to George and Juliet Bristow's Pilot Boat Inn on the Isle of Wight, where some of the guests are amazed by the building - yet others are shocked to find cobwebs in their bedrooms. Also, the hosts' constant hovering at breakfast makes the diners feel uncomfortable.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lucy Roe welcomes her guests to Rutland Terrace in Stamford, Lincolnshire, and although they are delighted with the elegant decor, George and Juliet are unimpressed by their lack of en-suite facilities. Kevin and Robert are horrified by the state of their mattress, before being accused of attention seeking at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of a couple from Yorkshire who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Shelley and David Warner in their search for a property in Daytona, Florida, and shows them what they can get for their £230,000 budget. The Essex couple have high hopes as house prices in the sunshine state have fallen in recent times.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Preston, Lancashire: The Bombers in the Marsh.
programme.desc: Warton Marsh, near Preston in Lancashire, was the scene of a fatal mid-air collision between two American bombers in 1944. An attempt by Tony Robinson and the team to establish the cause of the disaster sees them digging the aircraft out of 6ft of mud and interviewing local eyewitnesses and US pilots.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Drumlanrig, Dumfries: Fighting on the Frontier.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on an excavation close to Drumlanrig Castle, near Dumfries, where the Duke of Buccleuch discovered what he believes may be the remains of a huge Roman fort. They have three days to investigate their host's suspicions - which if confirmed would make it the most northerly example of its type ever found, and change current understanding of Roman history in Scotland.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to operate on Jasper, a 17-week-old Staffie puppy whose legs are growing in the wrong direction, while Labrador Mojo has a spinal problem that will lead to paralysis unless he goes into surgery. Plus, when a cat called Lolli, belonging to nine-year-old Lola, is brought in with a broken pelvis, the `Bionic Vet' must carry out a pioneering procedure to help the animal walk again.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend lead a team of experts as they attempt to renovate a US army Jeep that survived the Second World War but was later damaged in an arson attack. They hope a rapid turnaround on the vehicle will dazzle and surprise its current owner, Dick Masters.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of architect Richard Hawkes and his wife Sophie, as they move from London to the Kent countryside to build a hi-tech eco-friendly house with room to grow their own food. Richard also wants their new home to blend effortlessly into the surrounding countryside, concealed beneath a huge arch of clay tiles covered with earth and planted with grass.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: The firm takes on a new client accused of cyber-terrorism. An accident brings Diane and Kurt together, and Henry reveals new truths about the scandal to Maia. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Mega Yachts
programme.desc: Documentary about the Monaco Yacht Show, where over 100 of the largest yachts on the water are up for sale, with billionaire buyers competing to own the most extravagant vessels. The programme follows those who make, buy and work on these craft, including a Soho businessman planning to sail around the world, a broker with 25 years experience looking to sell a £130 million yacht, and a billionaire installing a crystal chandelier in his floating palace.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. Plus, a man who fell from a ladder and landed on his head, and a widower who had a nasty encounter with a mandoline while chopping vegetables.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.desc: In light of the unmasking of Jimmy Savile as a predatory sex offender, and 15 years on from the BBC documentary When Louis Met Jimmy, Louis Theroux sets out to understand how a man who was at the centre of British entertainment and charitable fundraising for decades was able to get away with a long litany of crimes. Louis talks to some of Savile's victims and people who worked closely with him, and re-examines moments from the original film as well as footage that's never aired before on television.(n)

With a third girl already missing, the officers - led by the capable but unstable DI Vivienne Deering - face a race against time to rescue her. programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, who started out building their own extension to meet the needs of their growing family, only to receive a double blow when husband Neil was made redundant and their youngest child Ben began to show signs of autism. The builders have just 10 days to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life - but as usual, local tradesmen and other members of the community turn out in force to help.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developer Martin Roberts visits the Midlands and Cumbria to meet a couple and a man who are all determined to make money from their property investments. Meanwhile, Lucy Alexander is serenaded by an opera singer who develops properties in his spare time.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who want to leave suburbia and start a new life in the country with their cats and a garden large enough to accommodate a vegetable patch. With a budget of £800,000, they hope to find a property in Kent or East Sussex that also features a utility room and a study.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Adrian McKeown from Carrickfergus, Co Antrim, hopes a week in Melbourne will convince his wife they should move to Australia with their two daughters.(n)

programme.title: My Ghost Story
programme.desc: A woman under assault by an aggressive entity is rescued by the spirit of her deceased son, and the ghost of a murdered maid is seen at a hotel.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin look out for ghostly gunslingers who may be lurking at a Nevada theme park that was once a settlers' camp.(n)

programme.title: Animal SOS
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of RSPCA officers across the country as they try to rescue pets and wildlife from harm, and give them better lives.(n)

The builders have just 10 days to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life - but as usual, local tradesmen and other members of the community turn out in force to help.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: The doctors return to Spain's Costa del Sol, where the mobile clinic is visited by a man worried about a large lump on his testicle. Back in the UK, Dr Dawn Harper tackles a case of a hairy female bottom, and Dr Christian Jessen sees a woman with an embarrassing vaginal discharge. The medics also encounter a man who has to breathe through a hole in his neck, and take to the beach to remind holiday-makers of the dangers of fun in the sun.(n)

programme.title: Millionaire Basement Wars
programme.desc: London's super-rich are maximising their properties as never before, by digging down and creating new basements to house anything from cinemas, swimming pools and squash courts to wine cellars and servants' quarters. However, some take as long as three years to complete - and the noise of the digging, fleets of concrete mixers and builders' lorries has made daily life hell in some of the capital's poshest neighbourhoods. This documentary tells the story of the conflict that has resulted from some of these improvements, going behind the scenes as Kensington council responds to angry residents, and featuring contributions from owners, builders and irate neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: The case of Natasha Cornett, who together with five friends tried to carjack a van, killing the driver, his wife and their six-year-old daughter. Plus, Lasonya Larry, who was convicted of stabbing her boyfriend in their Florida apartment.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Aloha Kekahi I Ke Kahi (We Need Each Other).
programme.desc: McGarrett and Wo Fat escape from prison, but the NLM gunmen aren't far behind, while terrorists pin down the location of Kono and Adam's safehouse, storm the Five-0 headquarters and take everyone hostage. Elsewhere, light is shed on Doris's relationship and a new SWAT captain arrives in town. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick, with Alex O'Loughlin and Chi McBride.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: A'ale Ma'a Wau (Fish Out of Water).
programme.desc: The team crosses paths with a tough Texas Ranger who arrives on the island in search of his missing daughter. Kono and Adam's security is compromised and Catherine receives a job offer from an old friend. Crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Michelle Borth.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Series following the rescue and rehabilitation of more than 160 neglected and abused primates at the Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Dorset, which the founder and his wife built into a 65-acre wildlife park that is home to 15 species.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Staff are at a loss to know what is wrong with Trudy the chimp, and one of two capuchin monkeys brought back from Spain by Alison and Jeremy makes a bid for freedom.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his exploration of the archipelago with a look at how, despite their proximity, no two of the 19 islands are the same. He also uncovers evidence that evolution on Galapagos is occurring faster than Charles Darwin could ever have imagined, and encounters Lonesome George, the last remaining giant Pinta Island tortoise, which died just a few weeks after filming in June 2012.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A simple error threatens everything when Manny and Luke put on a fancy winter ball at the school, while Mitchell gets a wake-up call when he offers to help.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch gets a shock when Cam calls a concierge to save his ruined New Year's Day feast, while Phil's dad Frank causes waves when he brings a date. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is incensed that an anonymous and rude parent robbed him of a precious moment with Lily during her recent dance recital and goes to extremes to uncover her identity and give her a peace of his mind. programme.desc: Jay shows a bit of favouritism when he and Gloria must deal with Joe's inappropriate Valentine gift-giving and Manny's dating indecisiveness, while Cam and Mitch try to get Lily, Haley and Sal to stand up to the men in their lives, but things don't turn out as planned.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross travels to Northern Ireland to find that, more than 15 years after the Good Friday peace agreement, the country is still deeply divided. Setting out to discover what makes people on both sides reluctant to let go of the past, he meets taxi drivers who offer tours of the sites of the Troubles, sees the towering `peace walls' that keep the different communities apart and witnesses a peak in the violence during the July marching season. He also accompanies police officers to see how they try to keep the peace as the bottles and bricks rain down on the first of four nights of protest.(n)

programme.desc: Red's past catches up with him and sets him on a dangerous collision course with an enemy determined to destroy his criminal empire. Crime thriller, starring James Spader.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Sam and the team continue to work with Hetty's former Vietnam War colleagues as they begin a risky investigation into a gold heist.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: An overseas mission goes wrong when Angus and the team are blamed for a terrorist bombing and they must avoid the authorities for long enough to clear their names.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores Newcastle, discovering strange sounds by the river and finding out how traditional culture is being reinterpreted in the Byker district. He goes behind the scenes at Newcastle United with local football hero Peter Beardsley, learns about the history of adult comic Viz from former editor Simon Donald and accompanies comedienne Sarah Millican to her favourite part of the city.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: When it is discovered that a recently deceased elderly woman had been using someone else's identity for decades, Rush reopens the 1954 case of a housewife who was committed to a mental institution for almost killing her son after setting a house fire. Crime drama, with Kathryn Morris and Diane Ladd.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The maverick medic treats a stubborn and egotistical doctor who has fallen ill while dispensing tuberculosis medicine in Africa. Although the stricken man has all the symptoms of TB, House is convinced something else is responsible for his sickness - but, to highlight the cause he has been promoting, the patient refuses medication. Ron Livingston guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a homicide case ends in a hung jury, Erin is forced to take over the investigation from her colleague, ADA Kelly Blake, and - with the help of DA investigator Anthony Abetemarco - find a missing witness. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is interrogated by the District Attorney's investigator when his ex-partner is accused of planting evidence in order to wrap up a homicide case. Meanwhile, Frank grapples with the limits of free speech. Starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A diary is discovered on a recycled computer, prompting Rush to reopen investigations into a woman's death. The victim had briefly enjoyed success as an internet millionaire before dying in 1999, seemingly of a stress-induced heart attack. Her main programmer is suspected of being somehow involved, but he has an airtight alibi. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The misanthropic doctor treats a student who is suffering electric shocks inside his body. The team wonders whether the man's symptoms are connected to a holiday in Jamaica - but it is not until his father reveals the nature of the family business that the real reason becomes clear. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank's first partner announces plans to publish a book filled with stories of their early days on the force, prompting the police commissioner to worry his personal secrets might be about to be made public. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A mobster is found shot in his car, with his low-level errand boy tied up in the trunk. Meanwhile, an NYPD officer asks for a new shield number - the same one as Frank's deceased son Joe. Crime drama starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez team up with two visiting operatives to search for a dangerous Russian fugitive who entered the US on a diplomatic visa.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemy
programme.desc: Chloe is forced to accompany Beranger on a visit to his dying mother, whilst back in Vielsart a birthday party gets out of hand.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Carmela confronts Tony about his infidelity, Christopher has a near-death experience, and Paulie is shaken up by a message from the underworld. Drama, starring James Gandolfini.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony learns there was an eyewitness to the Bevilaqua hit, so begins gathering money in case he needs to go on the run. Richie tries to persuade Junior to aid him in his plans. Carmela has a romantic encounter, and Big Pussy comes under pressure from the FBI.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemy
programme.desc: Chloe is forced to accompany Beranger on a visit to his dying mother, whilst back in Vielsart a birthday party gets out of hand.(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: While Hannah has a run-in with her old nemesis Tally, Elijah tries to convince Dill that they should be `exclusive'. programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: Elijah and Loreen help Hannah prepare for the Moth Story Slam, while Marnie prepares to go on tour with Desi. Shoshanna's plan for an `anti-hipster' Ray's takes off and, after helping take care of Laird and Caroline's baby, Jessa and Adam have a massive row. Comedy starring Lena Dunham.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The documentary series concludes by telling the story of 20th-century Britain, including the many ways in which the nation was transformed by the two world wars. The programme explores the changing role of women through the decades, and examines some of the scientific and technological advances that had a significant impact on everyday life.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat explores the inner workings of six of the world's most powerful cities, meeting influential people and examining urban infrastructures. He begins in Mumbai, the most populous city in India, where he talks to the country's richest woman and one of the world's most popular film stars, as well as delving into the diamond trade.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming heads across the Irish Sea to Dublin, where he succumbs to the city's famous charm and meets some of its most fascinating characters. On a journey that takes in an 18th-century pleasure house and a burlesque life-painting class, Alan also stops off in Temple Bar for a pint with singer Sharon Corr, unlocks a mystery in Ireland's oldest library and uncovers a stylish secret that lurks behind the steel shutters of an old lock-up.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Glasgow, one of his favourite cities, to reveal unusual and often hidden sights and sounds overlooked by the public. Starting at the Necropolis, he travels to the world's oldest music hall before enjoying the views from a city-centre landmark. He also finds the time to take tea with a film star.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A pair of PoW tags are discovered in an abandoned drug den, leading Rush and the team to re-examine the 1972 shooting of a Vietnam veteran. They discover his wife had been having an affair while he was fighting in the conflict, and her lover becomes their prime suspect - but more sinister motives soon rise to the surface. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A professional cyclist is brought in suffering from severe respiratory distress. Although he admits to undergoing numerous performance-enhancing procedures including blood doping, the doctors struggle to locate the root of his problem - until House steps in with an idea.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a retired cop is accused of shooting his mugger, Frank must deal with the aftermath. Meanwhile, a man who killed Baez's friend 25 years ago returns, leaving her and Danny to figure out how to bring him to justice.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer cooperation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers, and green ants pulling together to build a nest.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs' ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent.(n)
